org.mindswap.utils
Class ServiceGenerator

java.lang.Object
  org.mindswap.utils.ServiceGenerator

public class ServiceGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

This class can be used for automated generation of (large amounts of) synthetic (i) OWL-S service descriptions or (ii) additional statements about an existing service description. Generated services and statements respectively will be added to a user provided OWLKnowledgeBase. In both cases only ABox assertions will be created. One or more ontologies can be loaded to the KB at instantiation time which will be used when synthetic individuals need to be created, with each new individual being an instance of a randomly selected named concept out of the loaded ontologies. By default, the LUBM ontology is used.

Constructor Detail

ServiceGenerator

public ServiceGenerator(OWLKnowledgeBase target,
                        java.net.URI... ontologies)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Create a new service generator that adds generated services to the given KB and also load all ontologies into the KB.

Parameters:
target - The target knowledge base to which all generated services will be added. If null a new one will be created.
ontologies - One or more URLs referring to ontologies to be loaded into the target KB. By default, if none is given (null), the ExampleURIs.ONT_LUBM ontology will be loaded into the KB.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - In case loading of some ontology failed for I/O related reasons.
Method Detail

generateAtomicServices

public void generateAtomicServices(java.net.URI baseURI,
                                   int numberOfServices,
                                   boolean useSubModels,
                                   boolean logProgress)
This method is functionally equivalent to invoking 
 generateAtomicServices(baseURI, numberOfServices, 2, 2, useSubModels, logProgress);

See Also:
generateAtomicServices(URI, int, int, int, boolean, boolean)

generateAtomicServices

public void generateAtomicServices(java.net.URI baseURI,
                                   int numberOfServices,
                                   int numberOfInputs,
                                   int numberOfOutputs,
                                   boolean useSubModels,
                                   boolean logProgress)
Generate synthetic OWL-S service descriptions. More precisely, a Service that presents a Profile, described by a AtomicProcess, and that supports a WSDLAtomicGrounding.

Each generated service will have two inputs and two outputs, each typed to a randomly selected OWL class from the ontologies that have been loaded at instantiation time. Furthermore, each service has a complete but synthetic WSDL grounding. As such, generated services can be regarded "complete" exemplary atomic services, which can't be invoked, however, because the actual Web service does not exist.

Parameters:
baseURI - Base URI used as a prefix for named individuals (Service, Process, Profile, Grounding, etc). Defaults to DEFAULT_BASE_URI if null.
numberOfServices - The number of services to generate. The upper limit mostly depends on available resources. For 32-bit machines, however, the upper limit is about 10^5 because of the 1,5GB heap memory boundary of most Java VMs.
numberOfInputs - Number of inputs to create for each generated service. For instance, a value of 5 results in a service having five inputs. Negative values can be used to create a random amount of inputs, uniformly distributed between 0 and the absolute value given. For instance, a value of -3 results in service profiles having n inputs, 0 ≤ n ≤ 3.
numberOfOutputs - Number of outputs to create for each generated service. For instance, a value of 5 results in a service having five outputs. Negative values can be used to create a random amount of outputs, uniformly distributed between 0 and the absolute value given. For instance, a value of -3 results in service profiles having n outputs, 0 ≤ n ≤ 3.
useSubModels - If true each service will generated in its own ontology, which will be added to the target KB. If false all services will be added to the base model of the target KB.
logProgress - If true generation progress messages will be logged, whenever progress = n * 10%, 1 < n ≤ 10.
Throws:
java.lang.AssertionError - If numberOfServices ≤ 0.

generateStatements

public void generateStatements(java.net.URI baseURI,
                               int numberOfStatements,
                               boolean logProgress)
Generate synthetic ABox assertions about the Service, Profile, Process, and Grounding of an atomic service. The KB is searched if it already contains an atomic service. If none was found a synthetic service will be created first using generateAtomicServices(URI, int, boolean, boolean).

Generated assertions are of the form (s,p,o), where p is randomly chosen from a set of 20 newly created synthetic predicates; o is a new synthetic named individual which is an instance of a randomly selected class out of the named classes in the ontologies that have been loaded at instantiation time (see getOWLClasses(); and s is the Service, Profile, AtomicProcess, the AtomicGrounding (WSDL or Java depending on what it actually is), and the MessageMap elements if it is a WSDL grounding, or the JavaParameter elements if it is a Java grounding.

Parameters:
baseURI - Base URI used as a prefix for named individuals. Defaults to DEFAULT_BASE_URI if null.
numberOfStatements - The number of statements to generate.
logProgress - If true generation progress messages will be logged, whenever progress = n * 10%, 1 < n <= 10.
Throws:
java.lang.AssertionError - If numberOfStatements < 1.

getOWLClasses

public java.util.List<OWLClass> getOWLClasses()
Returns:
Returns an unmodifiable view of all named OWL classes defined by the ontologies that have been loaded at instantiation time. The order of this list is undefined.

getKnowledgeBase

public OWLKnowledgeBase getKnowledgeBase()
Returns:
The target KB to which generated services will be added.

                 throws java.io.IOException
